thread.section_title: Business Breaking News | Finance & Business News | News.com.au
thread.title: Oroton forecast better than expected

author: Brianna Parkins
title: Oroton forecast better than expected
text:
LUXURY accessories retailer Oroton has forecast a better than expected full year result thanks to improved performance by its eponymous brand and its offloading of Brooks Brothers Australia.
CHIEF executive Mark Newman said the company forecasts underlying group earnings for the 2015 financial year to be $6.7 million, $2.2 million higher than the previously announced figure.
"The improvement is primarily due to better trading performance from our core Oroton brand in June and July and exclusion from underlying earnings of our share of the trading losses in the Brooks Brothers joint venture for the year," he said. The company expects sale of its stake in Brooks Brothers Australia to offset trading losses from the brand. The company sold its stake in Brooks Brothers Australia, including 13 retail stores, back to the US parent company only three years into the joint venture. Oroton's 2014/2015 third quarter earnings took a $2 million hit partly due to disappointing sales and margins in the high end US apparel brand. The handbag retailer entered deals with GAP and Brooks Brothers after the end of its partnership with Polo Ralph Lauren created an earnings hole. Despite the lifted forecast, this years group's earnings had dropped by half when compared to 2014's $13.3 million. The market approved the improved forecast, improving Oroton's shares by 19 cents to $2.14.
